titles.title: Intelligence Authorization Process Adjustment Act
To make technical corrections to Section 504 of the National Security Act of 1947 and to conform law and practice with respect to use of certain funds for intelligence activities.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S14195-14199)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Intelligence.

bill.summary: 10/21/1993--Introduced. Intelligence Authorization Process Adjustment Act - Amends the National Security Act of 1947 to require the Director of Central Intelligence, the Secretary of Defense, or the Attorney General, as appropriate, to notify the appropriate congressional committees of the intent to use for intelligence activities funds appropriated for an intelligence activity: (1) in excess of the amount specifically authorized by the Congress for such activity; or (2) in the absence of an amount specifically authorized for such activity.
